faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Renting Property in Sector 88 Gurgaon
faqSection.description: Get instant answers to your most pressing questions about the process, costs, and lifestyle associated with finding and securing a rental house in Sector 88, a prime residential location in New Gurgaon.

faqs.question: What is the typical lease duration required when I rent house in Sector 88
faqs.answer: The standard rental agreement in Sector 88, consistent with most parts of Gurgaon, is for a period of 11 months, which is then renewable upon mutual agreement. Some landlords are open to 12 or 24-month contracts, particularly for corporate leases or high-value independent houses. We always recommend confirming the minimum lock-in period and notice period requirements before finalizing your lease agreement to ensure compatibility with your long-term plans.

faqs.question: Are independent houses for rent in Sector 88 generally furnished or semi-furnished
faqs.answer: The majority of independent houses and builder floors available for rent in Sector 88 are semi-furnished. This usually includes essential fixtures such as built-in modular kitchen units, extensive storage wardrobes, modern bathroom fittings, and basic electrical fixtures like fans and lighting. Fully furnished options are less common but are available, typically at a significantly higher rental premium.

faqs.question: What security deposit is typically required for rental properties here
faqs.answer: Landlords in Sector 88 generally ask for a security deposit equivalent to two months' rent. This deposit is refundable at the end of the tenancy period, provided the property is returned in good condition, minus any damages beyond normal wear and tear. Occasionally, for ultra-luxury villas, the deposit might extend up to three months' rent, depending on the landlord’s preference and negotiation.

faqs.question: How reliable is the power and water supply in Sector 88 Gurgaon
faqs.answer: Sector 88 is part of New Gurgaon and benefits from relatively modern infrastructure. Power supply is generally reliable, and most independent houses and societies have mandatory full power backup facilities installed. Water supply is managed through municipal connections and often supplemented by borewell access in independent homes, ensuring consistent availability for residents.

faqs.question: What are the common extra charges or maintenance costs besides the rent
faqs.answer: In addition to the monthly rent, tenants are usually responsible for electricity consumption based on meter readings, water usage charges if applicable, and gas charges. If you rent within a society or gated community, a monthly common area maintenance (CAM) fee will also apply, covering security, common lighting, and facility upkeep. Always clarify which utility bills are included or excluded in the rent.

faqs.question: Is Sector 88 a good area for families moving to Gurgaon
faqs.answer: Yes, Sector 88 is highly recommended for families. Its planned layout, proximity to quality schools, abundance of parks, and focus on secure, gated living environments make it a peaceful and convenient residential option. The lower population density compared to central Gurgaon also contributes to a calmer atmosphere ideal for family life.

faqs.question: How close is Sector 88 to major commercial hubs like Cyber City
faqs.answer: Sector 88 offers excellent connectivity to major business districts. Via the Dwarka Expressway and NH 48, Cyber City is typically reachable within 30 to 45 minutes, depending on peak traffic conditions. This strategic location minimizes commuting stress while allowing access to employment centers.

faqs.question: Can pets be accommodated in houses for rent in Sector 88
faqs.answer: Policies regarding pets vary significantly by landlord and property type. While independent houses generally offer more flexibility regarding pet ownership, many society or builder floor owners may impose restrictions or require a larger, non-refundable pet deposit. It is crucial to inform our agents about your pet requirements upfront so we can filter suitable listings immediately.

faqs.question: What documents are needed to secure a rental house in this area
faqs.answer: To finalize a lease agreement, tenants typically need to provide valid identity proof such as Aadhar Card or Passport, address proof, PAN card, and employment verification or salary slips for background checks. Foreign nationals require a valid visa and residential permit. All documentation must be current and verifiable before agreement registration.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for property repairs and maintenance during the lease period
faqs.answer: Generally, the tenant is responsible for minor running repairs and routine maintenance up to a small specified value, often detailed in the lease. The landlord remains responsible for structural repairs, major electrical or plumbing failures, and replacement of fixtures due to normal wear and tear. Clear delineation of maintenance responsibilities is essential and covered in our detailed lease documents.
